vague_description: Determine the optimal number of strawberry and sugar cookies to bake given profit margins, demand limitations, and production constraints.
detailed_description: Zeta Bakery sells two types of cookies. They sell a strawberry cookie and a sugar cookie. Let's say they make x1 strawberry cookies, at a profit of \param{StrawberryProfit} each, and x2 sugar cookies, at a profit of \param{SugarProfit} each (x1 and x2 are unknowns both greater than or equal to 0). The daily demand for these cookies is at most \param{MaxStrawberryDemand} strawberry cookies and at most \param{MaxSugarDemand} sugar cookies. The bakery is short staffed and can make a maximum of \param{MaxProductionCapacity} cookies of either type per day. How much of each cookie should the bakery make in order to maximize profit?
target_objective: Maximize the bakery's profit from cookie production
target_constraints: Number of strawberry cookies x1 is non-negative
Number of sugar cookies x2 is non-negative
Up to MaxStrawberryDemand strawberry cookies can be sold per day
Up to MaxSugarDemand sugar cookies can be sold per day
A maximum of MaxProductionCapacity cookies of either type can be made per day
target_parameters: Maximum production capacity of the bakery
